idioms.reading: たるをしるものはとむ
idioms.meaning: content is the philosopher's stone, that turns all it touches into gold

lessons.japanese: スコットさんは企業家精神に富む経営者なんです。
lessons.indonesian: Scott is an entrepreneur with much spirit of enterprise.

lessons.japanese: その地方は天然資源に富む。
lessons.indonesian: The district is abundant in natural resources.
Iron ore occurs there in abundance.

lessons.japanese: 彼は頭が切れるでもなく機知に富むわけでもない。
lessons.indonesian: He is not witty or bright.

lessons.japanese: 彼の講演はユーモアに富むものだったので聴衆は喜んだ。
lessons.indonesian: The audience enjoyed his lecture as it was rich in humor.

lessons.japanese: 発明の才に富むその男性がその権威ある賞を初めて受賞した。
lessons.indonesian: The ingenious man received the prestigious award for the first time.

lessons.japanese: 天然資源に富む国は世界にたくさんはない。
lessons.indonesian: There are not many countries in the world that abound in natural resources.

lessons.japanese: スコットさんは企業家精神に富む経営者なんです。
lessons.indonesian: Scott is an entrepreneur with much spirit of enterprise.

lessons.japanese: その地方は天然資源に富む。
lessons.indonesian: The district is abundant in natural resources.
Iron ore occurs there in abundance.

lessons.japanese: 天然資源に富む国は世界にたくさんはない。
lessons.indonesian: There are not many countries in the world that abound in natural resources.
